name: cfcomponent
description:
Creates and defines a component object; encloses functionality
 that you build in CFML and enclose within cffunction tags.
 This tag contains one or more cffunction tags that define
 methods. Code within the body of this tag, other than
 cffunction tags, is executed when the component is
 instantiated.

params.name: extends
params.description:
Name of parent component from which to inherit methods and
 properties.

params.name: initmethod
params.description: Method that will be called when ColdFusion instantiates the component

params.name: implements
params.description:
Name of the ColdFusion interface or interfaces 
 that this component implements. If the 
 component implements an interface, it must 
 define all the functions in the interface, and the 
 function definitions must conform to the 
 definitions specified in the interface. For more 
 information, see cfinterface. 
 A component can implement any number of 
 interfaces. To specify multiple interface, use a 
 comma delimited list, of the format 
 interface1,interface2.

params.name: output
params.description:
Specifies whether constructor code in the component can
 generate HTML output; does not affect output in the body
 of cffunction tags in the component.

params.name: displayname
params.description:
A string to be displayed when using introspection to show
 information about the CFC. The information appears on the
 heading, following the component name.
 If the style attribute is set to document, the displayname
 attribute is used as the name of the service element in the WSDL.

params.name: hint
params.description:
Text to be displayed when using introspection to show
 information about the CFC. The hint attribute value
 appears below the component name heading. This attribute
 can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter.
 If the style attribute is set to document, the hint
 attribute is used as the document element of the service
 in the WSDL.

params.name: style
params.description:
Specifies whether a CFC used for web services uses
 RPC-encoded style or document-literal style:
 - rpc: RPC-encoded style, default
 - document: Document-literal style
 If you specify document, you must also specify the namespace,
 serviceportname, porttypename, and bindingname attributes.

params.name: namespace
params.description:
Specifies the namespace used in the WSDL when
 using the CFC as a document-literal style web service.
 If you don't specify this attribute, ColdFusion MX
 derives the namespace from the CFC class name.
 This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: serviceportname
params.description:
Specifies the name of the port element in the WSDL.
 This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: porttypename
params.description:
Specifies the name of the porttype element in the WSDL.
 This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: bindingname
params.description:
Specifies the name of the binding element in the WSDL.
 This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: wsdlfile
params.description:
A properly formatted WSDL file to be used instead of
 WSDL generated by ColdFusion MX.
 This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: serviceaddress
params.description: Specifies the SOAP URL of the web service.

params.name: persistent
params.description: Specifies CFC is persistent or not

params.name: entityname
params.description: Specifies the name of the entity. Entity name is the name used by the ORM related functions to work with the persistent CFC. If entityname is not specified, then the CFC name is taken as the entityname. The entityname must be unique in the application.

params.name: table
params.description: Specifies the name of the database table to which the CFC maps.

params.name: schema
params.description: Used to specify the schema name.

params.name: catalog
params.description: Used to specify the database catalog name.

params.name: dynamicinsert
params.description:
Specifies whether INSERT SQL is to be generated at runtime.
Only those columns whose values are not null are included in the SQL.

params.name: dynamicupdate
params.description:
Specifies whether UPDATE SQL is to be generated at runtime.
Only those columns whose values are not null are included in the SQL.

params.name: readonly
params.description: Specify whether table is readonly or not

params.name: selectbeforeupdate
params.description:
Specify whether Hibernate should never perform an SQL UPDATE unless it is certain that an object is actually modified.
In cases when a transient object is associated with a new session using update(), Hibernate performs an extra SQL SELECT to determine if an UPDATE is actually required.

params.name: batchsize
params.description: An integer value that specifies the number of records to be retrieved at a single instance.

params.name: optimisticlock
params.description:
Determines the locking strategy.
It can be any one of the following four values:
none
version
dirty
all

params.name: lazy
params.description: Whether loading is to be done lazily or not.

params.name: rowid
params.description: Row id

params.name: discriminatorColumn
params.description: Use this attribute to define the discriminator column to be used in inheritance mapping

params.name: discriminatorValue
params.description: Use this attribute to define the discriminator value to be used in inheritance mapping

params.name: joinColumn
params.description: Use this attribute to define the join column for inheritance mapping.

params.name: embedded
params.description: Marks CFC as embeded

params.name: cacheUse
params.description: Use this value to specify the caching strategy to be used for caching this component's data in the secondary cache

params.name: cacheName
params.description: Use this value to specify the name of the secondary cache.

params.name: saveMapping
params.description: Specifies whether the generated Hibernate mapping file has to be saved to disk. If you set the value to true, the Hibernate mapping XML file is saved with the filename "CFC name".hbm.xml in the same directory as the CFC.

params.name: accessors
params.description: If set to false, ColdFusion ORM does not generate the implicit getters and setters.

params.name: serializable
params.description: Specifies whether this component can be serialized. If you set this value to false, the component and the data in the component‚ This and Variables scopes cannot be serialized, so they are not retained on session replication, and the component is in its default state.

params.name: attribute
params.description: If the attribute is set to ‚Äúfalse‚Äù at the component level, then the implicit getters and setters for the individual properties are ignored.

links.title: Object Oriented Programming Tutorial
links.description: Course from Learn CF In a Week

examples.title: Script Syntax
Tag Syntax
examples.code:
<cfcomponent displayname="myComponent" output="false"> 
 <!--- functions and other values here ---> 
 </cfcomponent>
